questiontext.text: A 35-year-old male came with complaint of dysphagia for 2 months. The microscopic examination of the tracheal wall of a smoker patient reveals squamous epithelium cells from the thorax epithelium. The wall epithelial cell changing is termed.

A female patient complained lump on the lower left gum around 1st and 2nd premolar region. After a biopsy examination, the doctor said that the gingival enlargement was suspected as tumor which initiated by injury. What happens to cells when ischemic/hypoxic lesions occur?

A 65-year-old female felt that her teeth increasingly visible at the root area. The biopsy examination result showed that the gingiva is shrinking due to the aging process. What is the process of cell and tissue reduction called?

A 60-year-old female came to the oncologist with a complaint of oral cavity lump. After surgery, histopathological examination demonstrated a squamous epithelial malignant tumor. Characteristics of malignant tumor are:

answer.text: Cancer cells can indefinitely divide and become immortal
Cancer cells can easily be destroyed by the immune system
Cancer growth is not autonomous and can be regulated by physiological elements
Growth is limited and cannot invade neighboring networks

questiontext.text: Histopathological examination results of a 70-year-old man with a tumor on his tongue, showed malignant tumors originated from outer layer epithelial. What is the appropriate term for this type of tumor?

A 3 cm tumor has been surgically removed from a 20-year-old woman. The histopathology result demonstrated epithelial cells proliferation on the parotid gland, myoepithelial, stromal, fibrous spindle cells, and chondrocyte cells. These results are a feature of:

A patient came to the dental practice complaining swollen gums since 2 days ago. This complaint is accompanied by intermittent pain. On oral examination, in addition to swelling, the gingiva is also slightly reddish compared to the surrounding area. What kind of fluid that has increased in volume from the scenario even?

A patient came to the dental practice complaining swollen gums since 2 days ago. This complaint is accompanied by intermittent pain. On oral examination, in addition to swelling, the gingiva is also slightly reddish compared to the surrounding area. What is the proper term to describe the redness of the gingiva?
A dentist examined a patient and found reddish spots 2 mm in size on the buccal mucosa. What is the proper term for abnormalities in the form of bleeding spots in this area?

A 42-year-old male patient came to the dentist complaining that his tooth cavities were painful. Intra oral examination showed deep dental caries on 36. The patient had a history of heart valve disorder. The dentist planned to perform tooth extraction procedure. What procedures must be done prior to the tooth extraction?

A 6-year-old child came to the dentist with a complaint of cavity on the right mandibula posterior. The patient has a history of congenital heart defect and has had surgery. Patients are under control with a cardiologist. Intraoral examination showed dentin caries on 55,74,84 teeth What actions can be taken by a dentist to prevent bacterial endocarditis?

answer.text: Repeated treatment with general anesthesia on cardiologist approval
One-session treatment with general anesthesia on cardiologist approval
Repeated treatment with local anesthesia on cardiologist approval
One-session treatment with local anesthesia on cardiologist approval

questiontext.text: A 6-year-old child came to the dentist with a complaint of cavity on the right mandibula posterior. The patient has a history of congenital heart defect and has had surgery. Patients are under control with a cardiologist. Intraoral examination showed dentin caries on 55,74,84. teeth. Which intraoral bacteria that can cause endocarditis?

A 25-year-old female came with complaint of tooth pain since 2 weeks ago. The patient also complained nausea and vomiting in the last 2 months which was worsened in the past 1 week. Patients have been treated by a general practitioner for lack of menstruation for 3 months back and have done the examination. She prescribed with vitamins. What is the correct diagnosis for this patient on the above case?

A 25-year-old female came with complaint of tooth pain since 2 weeks ago. The patient also complained nausea and vomiting in the last 2 months which was worsened in the past 1 week. Patients have been treated by a general practitioner for lack of menstruation for 3 months back and have done the examination. She prescribed with vitamins. At what period of pregnancy does the patient mentioned above?

A 25-year-old female came with complaint of tooth pain since 2 weeks ago. The patient also complained nausea and vomiting in the last 2 months which was worsened in the past 1 week. Patients have been treated by a general practitioner for lack of menstruation for 3 months back and have done the examination. She prescribed with vitamins. What is the most contributed cause of tooth pain complaints above?

A 39-year-old female came to the dental clinic complaining of unhealed canker sores. Based on anamnesis it is known that her husband diagnosed with HIV/AIDS. Intraoral examination revealed more than 1 cm ulcer on the lower lip mucosa. The clinical findings of the case suggested that patients might also infected HIV/AIDS which are transmitted from her husband through the mode of transmission as below, EXCEPT:

A 45-year-old male, came to the clinic complaining of discomfort in the oral cavity that had been felt for a long time. Thorough anamnesis revealed that the patient is a subject of HIV/AIDS. Intraoral examination revealed a thick white layer on the mucosal surface and a bump on the gingiva. Below are the clinical findings that were closely related to the above patients, EXCEPT:

A 40-year-old man came to the dental clinic for an oral examination. Thorough anamnesis demonstrated that the patient is a subject of HIV / AIDS and also a heavy smoker. Intraoral examination revealed abnormalities of bluish-colored and slightly protruded gingiva. What is the most likely diagnosis of the patient's gingiva?

A 45-year-old male came to the Health Center to general check-up. Anamnesis revealed that patient commonly got headaches, dizziness, nausea, and experience fatigue. Smoking with salty and fat daily diet. Blood pressure measurement was 170/100 mmHg. The patient denied previous blood pressure measurement. Family history was unknown. What is the classification of hypertension in these cases (according to ESH 2013)?

A 45-year-old male came to the Health Center to general check-up. Anamnesis revealed that patient commonly got headaches, dizziness, nausea, and experience fatigue. Smoking with salty and fat daily diet. Blood pressure measurement was 170/100 mmHg. The patient denied previous blood pressure measurement. Family history was unknown. What are the possible etiopathogenesis of the case?

answer.text: Diet high in sodium and smoking

questiontext.text: A 45-year-old male came to the Health Center to general check-up. Anamnesis revealed that patient commonly got headaches, dizziness, nausea, and experience fatigue. Smoking with salty and fat daily diet. Blood pressure measurement was 170/100 mmHg. The patient denied previous blood pressure measurement. Family history was unknown. The 170 mmHg is referred to:

answer.text: Diastolic pressure on rest between pumping
Systolic pressure on rest between pumping
Blood pressure when heart ventricle filled in

questiontext.text: A male referred with ecchymosis points found on both upper and lower extremities. His doctor explained that he might had blood coagulation problems. Blood coagulation is important for below events, save for:

A male referred with ecchymosis points found on both upper and lower extremities. His doctor explained that he might had blood coagulation problems. His doctor also explained that there is coagulation factor which is play an important role via extrinsic pathway that is:

A male referred with ecchymosis points found on both upper and lower extremities. His doctor explained that he might had blood coagulation problems. There is also a possibility that he subjects to hemophilia A disease. Which factor that might be reduced in these diseases?

A male, 45-year-old complained heartburn and acid taste in his mouth. The heartburn symptoms usually occur after eating and become intensified at night. According to his doctor, the causa is the backflow of stomach acid to esophagus. What is the disease termed?

A male, 40 years old complained unhealed ulcer in his oral cavity. He informed more than 10 bowel movements in a day along with bleeding, especially at night. He also reported abdominal pain, and crampy feeling prior the bowel movement. His previous endoscopy result demonstrated granular appearance on large intestine, while the recent one showed massive ulceration on the same area. What might be the diagnosis of the scenario above.

A female came with a chief complain of unbearable pain in the abdominal area. Along with continuous diarrhea, occur the abdominal pain and crampy, rectal bleeding and fever. She told that she lost weight in the last 2 years. On clinical examination there was ‘fistula with tags’ on anal area, while the endoscopy result demonstrated ulceration on large intestinal. Biopsy result showed infiltration of inflammatory cells on all layers, plasma cells and lymphocyte found on the lamina propria. What diagnosis might suitable for the above scenario?

A 35-year-old male came to his dentist with a chief complain of ulcerations on mucosal labial inferior. Based on anamnesis, the ulceration proceeds by fever and feverish for the last two days. The ulceration was never happened before. However, he remembered that he once suffered a rash infection on his teenage age. Extra orally, found pustular skin lesion on his right index finger named herpetic whitlow. What kind of microorganism might cause this disease?

A 35-year-old male came to his dentist with a chief complain of ulcerations on mucosal labial inferior. Thorough anamnesis revealed that the ulceration proceeds by fever and feverish for the last two days. The ulceration was never happened before. However, he remembered that he once suffered a rash infection on his teenage age. Extra orally, found pustular skin lesion on his right index finger named herpetic whitlow. The causative microorganism for this scenario known to replicate on:

answer.text: Ribosomal organelle of the host cell
Golgi apparatus of the host cell

questiontext.text: A 35-year-old male came to his dentist with a chief complain of ulcerations on mucosal labial inferior. Thorough anamnesis revealed that the ulceration proceeds by fever and feverish for the last two days. The ulceration was never happened before. However, he remembered that he once suffered a rash infection on his teenage age. Extra orally, found pustular skin lesion on his right index finger named herpetic whitlow. According to its biological characteristic, replication area- the causative microorganism in this scenario is classified as:
A 25-year-old female came with chief complaint of swollen gingiva for 2 months ago. Biopsy result demonstrated over proliferation on the referred area. On which layer those proliferation might occur?

A 25-year-old female came with chief complaint of swollen gingiva for 2 months. Biopsy result demonstrated over proliferation on the referred area. The most upper layer where the cells found in the flat form is termed:

A 25-year-old female came with chief complaint of swollen gingiva for 2 months. Biopsy result demonstrated over proliferation on the referred area. If the most upper layer with the flattest cells demonstrated few nucleus residues is termed:

A male, 57-year-old came with complain of something wedging up on his buccal mucosa. Clinical examination reveals a white spot or plaque with a clear border. The withies un-scrapable area is caused by
It was reported that around 90% oral cancer are the oral squamous carcinoma. Carcinoma is a cancer with cell origin from:
A patient came to oral surgery clinic and diagnosed as benign tumour of epulis. Below are epulis microscopy feature, but:

A male, 52-year-old brought to hospital under unconscious situation. His vital sign reveals emergency hypertension which was manage by sublingual Nifedipine. What is pharmacokinetic reason in put sublingual nifedipine?

answer.text: Irritation caused by Nifedipine on stomach wall

questiontext.text: A lady, 25-year-old came with breathing difficulties. She was diagnosed with bronchial asthma and prescribed with salbutamol inhalation. Which of the following choices is true related to advantages of inhalation method to this kind of patients?

answer.text: Local and fast drug action on bronchial
Long time prescription has systemic effect
The inhalation drug will firstly go through liver
This drug is complicated for older or children

questiontext.text: A student, 22-year-old diagnosed with a complex anxiety which make her sleep disturbed. Her doctor prescribed 2 mg Diazepam once a day. These drugs help her felt better. However, 2 weeks after 2 mg diazepam intake, the sleep disturbance relapse and her doctor increase Diazepam to 5 mg once a day at night. What is the right terminology for those events?

Medical prescriptions are written using signs and symbols. Each sign and symbol have its own meaning to serve better communication between doctor and pharmacist. What is R/ sign mean on the prescription paper?

Medical prescriptions are written using signs and symbols. Each sign and symbol have its own meaning to serve better communication between doctor and pharmacist. If in a prescription written: ∫ 3 dd Cth 1 pc what does this means?

answer.text: 3 times a day 5 ml after meal
3 times a day 10 ml after meal
3 times a day 5 drops after meal
3 times a day 10 drops after meal
3 times a day 15 ml after meal

questiontext.text: Medical prescription are written using sign and symbols. Each sign and symbol have its own meaning to serve better communication between doctor and pharmacist. When a doctor prescribes a narcotic drug, what does he has to put on after the name of the drug in the prescription?

A lady in her 30s came with bad breath. Intra oral examination showed poor oral hygiene with supragingival and subgingival calculus. Her dentist planned to clean her teeth and would like to prescribe gargle to improve her oral hygiene. What pharmaceutical liquid medicine with oropharyngeal formula that can be prepared for her?
There are many pharmaceutical preparations with its own indication and contraindication. Which liquid pharmaceutical that is not recommended for ocular administration?
There are many pharmaceutical preparations with its own indication and contraindication. Which tablet form that has to be dissolve in water first before taken orally?

46. A 10-year-old boy came with fever that has lasts for 3 days. To treat the fever, patient was prescribed with a mixture of antipyretic and antibiotic written as below. Based on the information, which statement below is true?

R/ Paracetamol tab V

Amoxicillin tab V

m.f pulv No. X

S 3 dd pulv. I

answer.text: Dosage of paracetamol has to be recalculated because it is overdose
Have to add “dtd’ on material arrangement part
Dosage of amoxicillin needs to be increased

questiontext.text:
A 5-year-old girl is prescribed with prescription below. Based on the information, which statement below is true?

R/ Ibuprofen film coated tab ¼

     SL                            qs

m.f pulv No. X

S 3 dd pulv. I

answer.text: Term of medicine intake should be change to 1 dd
Dosage of ibuprofen needs to be increased
Have to add “dtd’ on material arrangement part

questiontext.text: A 10-year-old boy came with fever that has lasts for 3 days. To treat the fever, patient was prescribed with a mixture of antipyretic and antibiotic. Which of the pharmaceutical preparation below might be suitable?

A 58-year-old lady came to UNHAS Dental Hospital with dry mouth and continuous thirst in the past year. Patient also report sweaty and crampy feet. Based on the information, what systemic disease might cause the symptoms?

A 58-year-old lady come to UNHAS Dental Hospital with dry mouth and continuous thirst in the past year. Patient also report sweaty and crampy feet. Other that the reported symptoms, what other symptoms the patient might have?

A 40-year-old male came to the hospital to have his yearly check-up. He’s been doing it regularly for the past several years. Blood sugar examination shows fasting blood sugar level was 100 mg/dl. Based on the test result, which category is he in?

A 30-year-old lady is referred by an Internist to a dentist for intraoral sore and swollen gum. The condition has lasts for 3 months. Patient also report dry mouth and bad breath. Intraoral examination showed ulcer, pseudo-membrane on dorsum of the tongue, gingival bleeding and deep caries on 46. Laboratory test showed Hemoglobin 7 g/dl, normal MCV and MCHC, Urea 300 mg/dl, and Creatinine 30 mg/dl. What is possible systemic diagnosis overlying patient’s intraoral conditions mentioned above?

A 30-year-old lady is referred by an Internist to a dentist for intra oral sore and swollen gum. The condition has lasts for 3 months. Patient also report dry mouth and bad breath. Intraoral examination showed ulcer, pseudo-membrane on dorsum of the tongue, gingival bleeding and deep caries on 46. Laboratory test showed Hemoglobin 7 g/dl, normal MCV and MCHC, Urea 300 mg/dl, and Creatinine 30 mg/dl. Based on the symptoms, which stadium of renal disease is she?

A 30-year-old lady is referred by an Internist to a dentist for intra oral sore and swollen gum. The condition has lasts for 3 months. Patient also report dry mouth and bad breath. Intraoral examination showed ulcer, pseudo-membrane on dorsum of the tongue, gingival bleeding and deep caries on 46. Laboratory test showed Hemoglobin 7 g/dl, normal MCV and MCHC, Urea 300 mg/dl, and Creatinine 30 mg/dl. What is normal rate for creatinine serum in blood?

A male of 48 years old checking himself up because of pain while urinating. Anamnesis revealed that he is in a LGBT community. Based on clinical examination, doctor decided to proceed with laboratory tests on the genital lesions and the result showed Human Papilloma Virus. What other possible differential diagnosis for the patient?

A 37-year-old lady visited her doctor for pain in her genital area that had started 3 weeks ago. Anamnesis revealed that her husband was working as an intercity delivery driver. Clinical examination showed chancre on vulvae and erythema. What is possible diagnosis for the patient?

A 54-year-old man visits the doctor for the pain he feels in his genital area for the last couple of months. Patient lives in a very dense community and admitted that he hasn’t been keeping good hygiene on his genital area. Examination shows a bacteria colonization with incubation characteristic of 90 days, and it is part of spirochete group. What is the name of the bacteria in the case?

A 35-year-old male visited Dental hospital to treat his decayed tooth. Examination indicated extraction for the tooth. Anamnesis uncovered that he had Tuberculosis since last year and had done 4 months of ATD treatment. Latest chest X-Ray showed minimal pleura effusion. What is the treatment plan for the case?

answer.text: Extraction in isolated room with standardized PPE

questiontext.text: A 42-year-old male visited Dental Hospital to check sores on his tongues that had lasted for 5 months and didn’t heal up. Patient has chronic cough and breathing difficulty. Three months prior, patient was suspected with Tuberculosis and undergoing Mantoux test with result of skin reaction induration of <5 mm. Patient is PWHA (Person with HIV and Aids) and undergoing ARV therapy. What is interpretation of the Tuberculosis status based on the skin induration result from the test?
Tuberculosis is an infection that caused by aerobe bacteria. There are several preventive actions that can be performed such as vaccination. What vaccine is indicated for this infection?
